OK thanks.

Though I'm no expert, isn't this sort of the way the scanning b=
oxes work in general?=A0 By scanning the broadcast frequencies, they are "c=
utting and pasting", so to speak, words from whatever happens to be on that=
 frequency at the time the scan hits it into an audio stream?=A0 If so, the=
n it seems to me that the difference between people doing the cut and paste=
, and the box doing it, is that people are making their own interpretations=
 before the final audio steam is constructed, and with the box the people a=
re making subjective interpretations after the final audio stream is constr=
ucted.=A0 So there is no difference in the overall methodology, just the sp=
ecific point where the person injects their own opinions?


--- On Thu, 6/4=
/09, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:

From: Frank Sumptio=
n <purplealiengirl@...>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] lInks to ghost labs,
T=
o: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Thursday, June 4, 2009, 9:35 AM










=

    
            
            


      
      =A0They claim they're just r=
emoving junk noise in between words to help clarify the messages, but it's =
these same people that claim to be top box experts.=A0 To me if you take di=
sconneccted words and connect them, it's kinda suspect.=A0 No doubt this wi=
ll be forwarded to those involved. 

=A0
=A0I'll isolate segments with the =
messages, but thats' as far as I go.
=A0
=A0F-S
=A0

=A0
On Thu, Jun 4, 200=
9 at 7:50 AM, Rj <rasterer@yahoo. com> wrote:

ou mean by "cut an paste voices together"?

t those attacks. One qusetion=A0would be why some think it's ok to cut an p=
aste voices together.
